alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 7:02PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...LOCALIZED POCKETS OF FREEZING RAIN EARLY TONIGHT FOR THE LAKE GEORGE AND NORTHERN SARATOGA REGION... A mixture of plain rain and localized pockets of freezing rain will impact northern Saratoga, southeast Warren and Washington counties prior to 9 pm. Temperatures are hovering near the freezing mark at some locations, and any untreated surfaces may become slippery due to light ice accumulations. Temperatures will continue to warm above freezing prior to midnight with plain rain. Motorists and pedestrians should remain alert for the possibility of slick or icy roads and walkways, especially on untreated ground surfaces.

area.areaDesc: Northern Saratoga; Northern Washington; Southeast Warren; Southern Washington
